tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE research_findings (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    study_title VARCHAR(255),
    researcher_name VARCHAR(255),
    eco_system VARCHAR(100),
    findings_text TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE gmo_effects (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    effect_type VARCHAR(100),
    effect_description TEXT,
    gmo_strain VARCHAR(100),
    eco_system VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE gmo_cultivation (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    cultivation_method VARCHAR(100),
    crop_type VARCHAR(100),
    gmo_strain VARCHAR(100),
    eco_system VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE research_findings (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    ecosystem VARCHAR(255),
    gmo_species VARCHAR(255),
    effect_on_environment TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE researchers (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    affiliation VARCHAR(255),
    email VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE ecosystems (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    type VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE gmo_species (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    origin VARCHAR(255),
    modification_technique VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE GMO_Research (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    crop_type VARCHAR(100),
    research_date DATE,
    findings TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE Ecosystems (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    ecosystem_name VARCHAR(100),
    climate VARCHAR(100),
    soil_type VARCHAR(100),
    vegetation TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE Researchers (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100),
    specialization VARCHAR(100),
    institution VARCHAR(100),
    email VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE Experiments (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    experiment_name VARCHAR(100),
    researcher_id INT,
    ecosystem_id INT,
    duration_days INT
);

CREATE TABLE Results (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    experiment_id INT,
    parameter VARCHAR(100),
    result_value FLOAT,
    interpretation TEXT
);
